meanings.definition: Characterized by the sound of splashing or washing.
meanings.sent1: The swashy waves crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent2: The river was swashy after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The swashy fountain in the park delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a swashy waterfall, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The swashy sound of the dishwasher running lulled her to sleep.

meanings.definition: Having a tendency to make a lot of noise or showy display.
meanings.sent1: The swashy party next door kept me up all night.
meanings.sent2: The peacock's swashy feathers caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: His swashy outfit at the event turned heads.
meanings.sent4: The swashy fireworks lit up the night sky with a bang.
meanings.sent5: The swashy car horn startled the pedestrians on the street.

meanings.sent1: The swashy pirate captain commanded the ship with confidence.
meanings.sent2: His swashy attitude made him popular among his peers.
meanings.sent3: The swashy hero in the movie always saved the day.
meanings.sent4: She walked with a swashy gait, exuding self-assurance.
meanings.sent5: The swashy speech inspired the crowd to stand up for what they believed in.
